body_text:
Why didn't the experimentation for the 13-day rule push through? In the episode where L dies, he mentions wanting to test the 13-day rule. If the 13-day rule is disproven, Light and Misa become suspects again. L dies and then apparently everyone seems to have forgotten about the test. What happened?
I seem to recall most of the task force disagreed with L and then when he died, the majority opinion prevailed.

Why didn't L check for fingerprints or hair? Related to this: Death note handwriting check
A lot of DNA must have rubbed off on the Death Notes. Unless the Death Note has a rule about fingerprints or DNA, I don't see how this isn't a plothole.
